column4: Anyone have any idea about the images Brasero creates? This is weird and annoying
whats anoying?
I can't tell what kind of filesystem it used to make the image. It makes a small .toc file and a large disk image with no extension. "file" command just returns "data" on it
and Googling around got me nowhere. Tried mounting it as a .bin and an ISO9660
its probably just a byte for byte copy of the image, so an iso if the cd was in iso format
you try mounting without specifying the fstype?
yup, and "auto" mode. Says "you must specify the filesystem type."
is it maybe a format to be opened by brasero?
that's what I need to find out. I mean obviously the .toc files are meant to be burned by Brasero, yes. I just want to avoid wasting discs on each one of these images (I have 6 or 7)
audio cds arent mounted
alright...but is there any way I can rip the audio data from the images without burning them to physical discs?
probably, witch tool do you use? just setup a loop and tell the ripping software that is your cd device
That is exactly my plan, but first I need to have the image mounted
no you dont mount it
so just point a ripping tool at the file?
yeah or if the tool doesnt like a file use losetup or w/e its called
what program do you normally use to rip your audio cds?
Rubyripper, now. Used to use sound-juicer and various stuff. But like I said I had none of those options when I made these images.

Geistanon: Thanks very much for your help! Finally figured it out. Needed to use bin2iso to convert the .toc file to .cue, and then bchunk to convert the .bin and .cue directly to WAVs with the "-w" switch
you could try one of the cd ripping tools you said you have used before using your file as the cd device
I can try that I suppose...
